page.title: 08Local history Shepreth
page.content: Mrs Daisy Plumb was born in Shepreth and always lived in the same house; many of the changes to Shepreth she remembers. When she was small there were 2 cement works, 4 pubs, 2 churches, 3 shops and 2 working mills. There used to be 36 glasshouses at Willlers Mill Fish Farm. Shepreth used to have its own school with 70 children. When they got to 11 they went to Foxton and went on strike till they were given solid tyre bikes. Electricity came to Frog End in 1950, water came in 1957, before then there were 2 pumps, one at each end of the the street. When Mrs Plumb was young they brought food from Royston by horse and cart not by cars.
